Convert CSV (from ggsem Shiny app) to ggplot2 output

Source: R/csv_to_ggplot.R
csv_to_ggplot.Rd

This function converts the four CSV files from the ggsem Shiny app into a ggplot2 output object. The ggplot2 output can then be modified using standard ggplot2 functions, such as ggtitle() and annotate().

Usage

csv_to_ggplot(
  points_data,
  lines_data,
  annotations_data,
  loops_data,
  element_order = c("annotations", "self_loops", "points", "lines")
)

Arguments

points_data

The object that stores the CSV file containing information about points from the ggsem Shiny app.

lines_data

The object that stores the CSV file containing information about lines from the ggsem Shiny app.

annotations_data

The object that stores the CSV file containing information about text annotations from the ggsem Shiny app.

loops_data

The object that stores the CSV file containing information about self-loop arrows from the ggsem Shiny app.

element_order

Order of the graphical elements on display. The default is set so that annotations are at the most front and lines at the most back. This can be changed by providing a vector of four elements of strings, such as: c("self_loops", "annotations", "points", "lines")

Value

Returns a ggplot2 object.
